title: Understanding Conditional Formatting
text: Conditional formatting is a feature in spreadsheet applications that allows you to apply specific formatting to cells that meet certain criteria. This can help highlight important information or trends in your data.

title: Identifying the Purpose of Conditional Formatting
text: What is the main purpose of using conditional formatting in a spreadsheet?
choices: Changing the values of certain cells
Editing cells in a certain range

title: Applying Conditional Formatting
text: To apply conditional formatting, you typically select the range of cells you want to format, then set the conditions and choose the formatting style (e.g., color, font style).

hintAnswer: Select cells, set conditions, choose formatting
title: Steps to Apply Conditional Formatting
text: What are the basic steps to apply conditional formatting in a spreadsheet?
choices: Select cells, set conditions, choose formatting
Select cells, change values, save changes
Select cells, delete data, apply changes
